title: Buffering in Computer Network
description: A buffer is a temporary memory storage area that holds data during transfer between systems or processes operating at different speeds. Its primary purposes are to: (1) compensate for speed mismatches between sender/receiver (e.g., streaming video), (2) prevent data loss during network congestion, (3) enable error recovery by storing data for retransmission, and (4) improve user experience by ensuring smooth data flow. Buffering is essential in networks, multimedia playback, and I/O operations to maintain efficiency and reliability.
